    Our team has an original idea of creating a smart mirror. The goal is to create a mirror that shows useful information to its users, such as time, date, weather, commute information, and more.

    The name Mirroculous comes from the combination of “mirror” and “miraculous”. To make it real, we are going to need the following items:

    Semi-transparent mirror 24” or larger screen

    Picture frame

    RaspberryPi with a micro-HDMIcable

    SenseHat

    The Raspberry Pi will run the open-source MagicMirror software and we are going to write the UDP server communication script for the sensorhub, therefore, we can show the temperature on the mirror, upload it to the database, and view a log on the website which will also be used for remote configuration. The website will use Bootstrap and TypeScript as a design template. The modules we are going to use are:

    Time and Date

    Weather information

    Calendar

    Commute information

    Room temperature and humidity status

    Weather Settings

    Input the "location number 1" which is in this case. the location where the mirror is going to stay & in the "location number 2" input your work , commute address. Remember that the locations follow the principle of A to B.
